conversation_history.text: Warehouse survey, 1994. Moody said don't enter—rotted floors. I entered anyway. Floor collapsed two stories down. Last thought was Samuel would've known better. Now I'm here instead of there.

You approach the heavy oak desk, its surface a chaotic sprawl of parchment and quills. As you sift through the scattered papers, examining their contents and arrangement, you've already combed through this thoroughly—there are no new revelations to be found here. The desk itself bears no marks or secrets beyond what you've already discovered.

The body lies crumpled near the frost-covered window, pale and still. You recognize the distinctive robes and silver hair—it's Professor Severus Snape, the Potions master. His wand remains gripped tightly in his lifeless hand, and the scattered papers across the oak desk suggest he was working when something went terribly wrong. The Dark Arts books surrounding him loom like silent witnesses to whatever transpired here.
wow, snape! oh no. i want to look inside his pockets

You approach the slumped figure of Professor Snape, his dark robes pooled around him like spilled ink. Your fingers tremble slightly as you reach toward his pockets, the cold from the frost-covered window seeming to radiate across the library. The wand still clutched in his rigid hand catches the pale light filtering through the glass.

What specific pocket would you like to search?

You've already examined this thoroughly. The frost pattern on the window, the hidden note discovered among the desk papers, and the wand's magical signature—each piece has revealed what it could. The library falls silent around you, the weight of your investigation pressing down like the dust on these forbidden tomes.
